item.title: Arch Linux (Hyprland)
item.description: My arch linux installation. Archinstall with Sway for base. No display manager Install yay Notes: Run as user NOT ROOT! 1git clone https://aur.archlinux.org/yay 2cd yay 3makepkg -si Packages 1yay -S hyprland-bin polkit-gnome ffmpeg neovim viewnior \ 2rofi pavucontrol thunar starship wl-clipboard wf-recorder \ 3swaybg grimblast-git ffmpegthumbnailer tumbler playerctl \ 4noise-suppression-for-voice thunar-archive-plugin kitty \ 5waybar-hyprland wlogout swaylock-effects pamixer \ 6nwg-look-bin nordic-theme papirus-icon-theme dunst Configuration Dotfiles SOON Wrapping the launcher 1#!/bin/sh 2 3export LIBVA_DRIVER_NAME=nvidia 4export XDG_SESSION_TYPE=wayland 5export GBM_BACKEND=nvidia-drm 6export __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME=nvidia 7export WLR_NO_HARDWARE_CURSORS=1 8 9 10exec Hyprland bash_profile 1if [[ -z $DISPLAY && $(tty) == /dev/tty1 && $XDG_SESSION_TYPE == tty ]]; then 2 exec /home/r4sso/.

item.title: Attacktive Directory
item.description: Enumeration Basic enumeration starts out with an nmap scan. Nmap is a relatively complex utility that has been refined over the years to detect what ports are open on a device, what services are running, and even detect what operating system is running. It’s important to note that not all services may be deteted correctly and not enumerated to it’s fullest potential. Despite nmap being an overly complex utility, it cannot enumerate everything.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.
